definition: ice/CL:塊|块[kuai4]/to chill sth/(of an object or substance) to feel cold/(of a person) cold/unfriendly/(slang) methamphetamine

sentences.english: Characteristics of sea ice floe size distribution in the seasonal ice zone.
sentences.chinese: 在季節性冰凍地帶海冰浮冰塊大小分佈的特性。

sentences.english: In spring the ice- floes break up.
Chunks of sea ice float in the water between the smooth iceberg and the coast.
sentences.chinese: 在大冰山和海岸之間的海水中漂浮着很多浮冰。

sentences.english: In spring the ice-floes break up.
At one point an ice floe the team's tent was moored on broke apart, although no one was injured.
sentences.chinese: 有一次，隊伍帳篷所在的浮冰破裂，所幸無人受傷。

sentences.english: The ice pack and icebergs pose various threats to drilling rigs and crews.
sentences.chinese: 浮冰和冰山對鑽機和人員構成多種威脅。

sentences.english: Two penguins are standing on an ice floe.
sentences.chinese: 兩隻企鵝站在一塊浮冰上。

sentences.english: You may choose not to untap Ice Floe during your untap phase.
sentences.chinese: 在你的重置階段中，你可以選擇不重置浮冰。

sentences.english: A large ice floe in the Arctic Ocean bears an icicle-trimmed cave.
sentences.chinese: 北冰洋上的一塊大浮冰裏孕育着一個冰錐狀的洞穴。

sentences.english: A protective pier or dock apron used as a buffer against floating ice.
sentences.chinese: 橋墩護檻保護橋槨免受浮冰碰撞的護欄或碼頭圍欄。

sentences.english: 6Floating ice fills a harbor in Ilulissat, Greenland, on July 18, 2011.
sentences.chinese: 浮冰漂在格陵蘭島伊盧利薩特的港口。

sentences.english: Ice-floes are a threat to shipping in the area.
sentences.chinese: 浮冰對這一帶的航運是一種威脅。

sentences.english: Two Atlantic walruses snuggle on an ice floe near Igloolik, Nunavut, Canada.
sentences.chinese: 格盧利克附近，兩頭大西洋海象在浮冰上相互偎依。

sentences.english: Polarbears usually subsist on seals, which they hunt from a platform of seaice.
sentences.chinese: 北極熊通常在浮冰上抓捕海豹作爲食物。

definition: dry land (as opposed to the sea)
